TREM-2 induces upregulation of CCR7, which plays a pivotal role in directing DCs from the periphery to the T cell rich areas of draining lymph nodes 1011121314.
Moreover, TREM2 stimulation of immature dendritic cells strongly induced expression of CCR7, a chemokine receptor binding the ligands CCL19 and CCL21.

These results demonstrate that TREM2 stimulation does not stimulate antigen presentation but up-regulates expression of the chemokine receptor CCR7 and supports chemotaxis towards the corresponding ligands CCL19 and CCL21.
